page.title: 06SUTTON PARK, BIRMINGHAM 1
page.content: SUTTON PARK IS AN AREA OF UNDULATING HIGH LAND WHICH REACHES A PEAK AT THE SCOUT JAMBOREE STONE.IN THE LOWER AREAS THERE ARE SOME SWAMPS AND IT IS EVIDENT THAT THERE IS ARTIFICIAL DRAINAGE.BECAUSE OF THAT THE PARK IS A SUITABLE AREA FOR SUCH EVENTS AS RUNNING AND CYCLO-CROSS.EVENTS INCLUDE LOCAL AND REGIONAL CROSS-COUNTRY RACES .THE DENSE NETWORK OF ROADS ALSO OFFERS EXCELLANT FACILITIES FOR THE INTERNATIONAL LOMBARD CAR-RALLY.THE MANY POOLS OF THE PARK ARE USED FOR SAILING AND FISHING FOR WHICH ONE PAYS 85p PER DAY.A VISITING FAIR COMES TO THE PARK IN JUNE,COINCIDING WITH THE SUTTON CARNIVAL.THERE IS ALSO A FAIR FOR YOUNG CHILDREN AT BOLDMERE GATE WHICH LASTS THROUGHOUT THE SUMMER.THE PARK ALSO OFFERS TWO FACILITIES FOR GOLFING,ONE PRIVATE COURSE AND MUNICIPLE ONE.
